Posts.Content: Feb 9, 2009 09:58PM - edited Feb 9, 2009 09:59PM by Stonebrook108 Hi Girls, I had LCIS and had a PBM on 1/9/09 and 4 wks. later feel great. My BS did skin sparring and my PS did direct implants not tissue expanders. I was like all of you so scared of the surgery. But, it wasn't anything like I thought it would be. I was so afraid of being in pain. I can honestly say  I didn't have much pain at all.Just stiffness and tightness across my chest. I now I'm numb across my new Foobs. The SN injection did hurt! And the drians weren't that bad I had 4 of them. But that was the worst part of everything. I even went home the next day. You can't really sleep lying down so if you can buy a wedge pillow. Or take the cushion off the back of a chair and lean it up againest your headboard then place your pillows there it much more comfortable. Down pick up anything heavy for the first week. Just take it easy if you can. If I can answer anyones questions please PM me or email me at Stonebrook108@aol.com So many woman were so helpful to me on this web site I would like to help if I can.Good luck to all of you. Be well, Ann

Posts.Content: Jan 18, 2010 10:37AM - edited Jan 18, 2010 10:40AM by Stonebrook108 I had 4 drains when I had my PBM. The nurse in the PS office put bacatracin oniment on the tubes where they came out of the skin. That kept the area moist. Then she took a piece of gauze folded in half around the drain tube up where they came out of the skin.Then she used paper tape and taped them flat on my skin. The gauze kept the bacatracin on the stiches and your able to hold down the tubes when you tape them flat. My husband would do it for me after I showered it worked great. My drain tubes were coming out of my armpits..UGH. But, the small incision is hidden there so it's good. I hope this helps
